alert.note: Alert for Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 10:03AM CDT until September 11 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bullock, Lee, Macon and Russell. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1003 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Tuskegee, Society Hill, Uchee, Davisville, Beauregard, Griffen Mill, Warriorstand, Creek Stand, Marvyn and Fort Davis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
